## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 297, 393, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 AS Level Structured Questions  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 386, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 490]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 500, 255, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 526, 767, 558]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used. You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 567, 760, 597]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 72, 181, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
A parallel beam of light consists of two wavelengths \(540\mathrm{nm}\) and \(630\mathrm{nm}\). The light is incident normally on a diffraction grating. Third-order diffraction maxima are produced for each of the two wavelengths. No higher orders are produced for either wavelength.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 133, 781, 151]]<|/det|>
Determine the smallest possible line spacing \(d\) of the diffraction grating.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 320, 918, 339]]<|/det|>
<form>d = .................................................... m [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 354, 180, 371]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 352, 920, 387]]<|/det|>
The beam of light in **(c)**(ii) is replaced by a beam of blue light incident on the same diffraction grating.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 399, 920, 433]]<|/det|>
State and explain whether a third-order diffraction maximum is produced for this blue light.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 537, 920, 556]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 11]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 395, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 165, 144, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>
